bibl.title: Letter from Ida E. and John R. Kissinger to Emilie Lawrence Reed, July 1, 1927

div1.p: The Kissingers thank Emilie Lawrence Reed for the gift of a painting.

div1.head: Letter from Ida E. and John R. Kissinger to Emilie Lawrence Reed, July 1, 1927
div1.opener:
July 1/27 Huntington
Huntington Co
Indiana
R R, 8
Mrs Walter Reed.
Dear Mrs Reed,
div1.p:
Your welcome letter,
to us and the very
beautiful Painting of
your flower garden.
Its certainly a welcome
present to us to hang
in our new home.
Its a wonderful place
and it means so much
to know we have so
many kind friends
and have been so Generous
to us;

Mr Kissinger is Surely,
pleased over the picture
because Its is your work
and from your own garden.
We appreciate It all the
more.

We have a wonderful place
lots of lovely Roses someday
we will send you a picture
of It. If you can get a
Trip out this way come
and see us oh we would
be so glad to have you
again we thank you

closer.signed:
Mrs John R. Kissinger
John R Kissinger
